data.meanings: to pass by, overlook, transgress, turn aside.. adwun - wickedly, unjustly, spitefully, wrongfully.. adi'yat - companies of warriors, chargers, horses of the warriors, wayfarers who run fast on their journey, swift horses.. aduwatun - enmity. udwan - hostility, injustice. aduwwan (pl. aduwun) - enemy.. . Ya'duuna (impf. 3rd. m. pl.): They transgressed; Programmed.. Laa Ta'du (prt. neg. m. sing.): Do not overlook, not let your eye turn away.. Laa Ta'duu (prt. neg. m. plu.): Do not transgress, violate.. 'Aad (act. pic. m. sing.): Transgressor; Who goes beyond the limits.. 'Aaduuna (act. pic. m. plu.): Transgressors; People who know no limits.. 'Adaytum (prf. 2nd. plu. III.): You are at enmity.. Yat'adda (imp. 3rd. m. sing. V): He trespasses, violates.. I'tadaa (prf. 3rd. m. sing. VIII): Violated.. I'tadan (prf. 3rd. m. plu. VIII.): They transgressed.. I'tadaina (prf. 1st. plu. VIII): We have transgressed.. Ya'taduuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. VIII): They transgressed.. Ta'taduu (imp. 2nd. m. plu. acc. final Nun dropped): You transgress.. Li Ta'taduu (imp. 2nd. m. plu. el.): That you may transgress.. l'taduu (prt. m. plu.): You punish for violence, punish for transgression.. Laa Ta'taduu (prt. neg. m. plu.): You transgress not.. Mu'tadun (ap-der. m. sing.): Transgressor.. Mu'taduun / Mu'tadiin (acc. ap-der. m. sing.): Transgressor.. 'Adwan (v. n. acc.): Transgressing.. 'Aduwwun / 'Aduwwan (acc. v. n.): Enemy.. A'da'un (n. pl.): Enemies.. 'Udwaanun (v. n.): Violence; Punishment of violence; Harshness; Injustice; Transgression.. 'Adaawatun (v. n.): Enmity.. 'Udwatun (n.): Side; End.. 'Adiyaat (act. pic. f. plu.): Panting; Running; Coursers..

'Aaduuna (act. pic. m. plu.): Transgressors; People who know no limits.. 'Adaytum (prf. 2nd. plu. III.): You are at enmity.. Yat'adda (imp. 3rd. m. sing. V): He trespasses, violates.. VIII): They transgressed.. Ta'taduu (imp. 2nd. m. plu. acc. final Nun dropped): You transgress.. Li Ta'taduu (imp. 2nd. m. plu. el.): That you may transgress.. l'taduu (prt. m. plu.): You punish for violence, punish for transgression.. Laa Ta'taduu (prt. neg. m. plu.): You transgress not.. Mu'tadun (ap-der. m. sing.): Transgressor.. Mu'taduun / Mu'tadiin (acc. ap-der. m. sing.): Transgressor.. 'Adwan (v. n. acc.): Transgressing.. 'Aduwwun / 'Aduwwan (acc. v. n.): Enemy.. A'da'un (n. pl.): Enemies.. 'Udwaanun (v. n.): Violence; Punishment of violence; Harshness; Injustice; Transgression.. 'Adaawatun (v. n.): Enmity.. 'Udwatun (n.): Side; End.. The word يَابَنِي comes from the root ب ن و and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: Becoming separated, severed, disunited, cut off or distinctApparent, manifest, plain, clear, known, distinguished from anotherDisunion and unionComing forthSeparation or division between two things (e.g. land)An evidence, an indication, demonstration, proof, argument that is clear, manifest (intellectual or perceptive/perceived by sense), testimony of a witness
data.sentence: The word مُبِينٌ comes from the root ب ي ن and is associated with the meanings: Becoming separated, severed, disunited, cut off or distinctApparent, manifest, plain, clear, known, distinguished from anotherDisunion and unionComing forthSeparation or division between two things (e.g. land)An evidence, an indication, demonstration, proof, argument that is clear, manifest (intellectual or perceptive/perceived by sense), testimony of a witness
The word إِلَيْكُمْ comes from the root ا ل ي and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: serve, worship, adore, venerate, accept the impression of a thing, obey with submissiveness or humility, approve, apply, devote, obedience, slave, keep to inseparably, subdue, assemble together, enslave.

data.meanings: to enjoin/charge/impose/swear. ahdun - treaty/covenant/promise/agreement/compact/oath, bond, condition, bequest, responsibility, guarantee, time, epoch, acquaintance, true, friendship, affection, security.
data.sentence: The word أَعْهَدْ comes from the root ع ه د and is associated with the meanings: to enjoin/charge/impose/swear. ahdun - treaty/covenant/promise/agreement/compact/oath, bond, condition, bequest, responsibility, guarantee, time, epoch, acquaintance, true, friendship, affection, security.
